server
Class Pathfinder<type,edgesType,weightType>

java.lang.Object
  server.Pathfinder<type,edgesType,weightType>
Type Parameters:
type - The generic type for the Node class
edgesType - The generic type for the Edge class
public class Pathfinder<type,edgesType,weightType>
extends Object

This class implements a Dijkstra's algorithm on a graph which is created from a database of nodes and edges.

Author:
Kirill Blazhko, Dmitry Igoshin

Constructor Detail

Pathfinder

public Pathfinder()

Pathfinder

public Pathfinder(Graph graph)
This constructor creates a Pathfinder object and does a shortest path calculation on it. The actual shortest path calculation is done in this method.

Parameters:
graph - - needs a Graph object to apply Dijkstra's algorithm to it
Method Detail

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method which parses a database into a graph, applies Dijkstra's algorithm to _each_node_ and then writes back the results to the 'paths' database table

Parameters:
args -

smallestUnvisitedNode

private Node smallestUnvisitedNode()
This method utilizes the ability of the Priority Queue object to quickly return a node with a smallest weight

Returns:
a node with a smallest weight (and deletes it from unvisitedNodes)

relaxNeighbours

private void relaxNeighbours(Node<type> current,
                             Graph<type,Integer> graph,
                             Predecessors predecessors)
This method is used by the Dijkstra's algorithm. It is a 'relax neighbor nodes' function.

Parameters:
current - The current node
graph - The Graph
predecessors - Predecessors of the current node

printShortestPath

public void printShortestPath(int startNode)
This method is a utility which helps to debug the Dijkstra's algorithm method

Parameters:
Start - node - the node for which we want to print all the shortest paths

savePathToDb

public void savePathToDb(Database db,
                         Node startNode,
                         Node endNode,
                         ArrayList<Integer> path)
This method saves all 'predecessors', i.e. path for a taken node to the 'paths' table in the database

Parameters:
db - Database name
startNode - Start node
endNode - End node
path - A string with the list of paths from the Start node
